conclusion: Analyze the flow path of the liquid from each inlet through the baffles.
Inlet A: Liquid flows downward and encounters the first baffle (pink).
Liquid from Inlet A will be directed towards the right.
Inlet B: Liquid flows downward and encounters the second baffle (green).
Liquid from Inlet B will be directed towards the left.
Inlet C: Liquid flows downward and encounters the third baffle (light blue).
Liquid from Inlet C will be directed towards the right.
Inlet D: Liquid flows downward and encounters the fourth baffle (white).
Liquid from Inlet D will be directed towards the left.
Liquid from A will continue to flow towards container F.
Liquid from B will continue to flow towards container E.
Liquid from C will continue to flow towards container F.
Liquid from D will continue to flow towards container E.
Liquids from inlets A and C will flow into container F.
Liquids from inlets B and D will flow into container E.
Container E will receive liquid from inlets B and D.
Container F will receive liquid from inlets A and C.
